summary: After a significant offshore oil spill—such as the Exxon Valdez or Deepwater Horizon incidents—it can take decades and billions of dollars to undo the environmental damage. A federal-state trustee council is set up after a spill to manage the money for related environmental restoration projects. Federal research on environmental restoration after an oil spill could be relevant to the trustee councils' work. But we found...
title: Offshore Oil Spills: Restoration and Federal Research Efforts Continue, but Opportunities to Improve Coordination Remain
